intro: Galium cynanchicum, commonly known as black nightshade or wild nightshade, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in cymes, and its fruit is a capsule containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Galium cynanchicum is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
